title: Open taproom
purpose: Explain the waiter or opening staff the exact steps to open the taproom for the guests later in the day.
scope: All employees assigned to open the taproom during operating days.
steps: 1. Enter building and disable security system if active.
2. Turn on lights in all guest-accessible areas.
3. Check for cleanliness; do a quick walkthrough.
4. Wipe tables and surfaces if needed.
5. Unlock bathrooms and check soap, paper, and cleanliness.
6. Turn on POS tablet and test connection.
7. Check taproom fridge and cider/mead taps for readiness.
8. Open outside doors/windows if weather allows (Biergarten).
9. Play opening playlist or light ambient music.
10. Place chalkboard/menu with today’s offerings outside.
11. Log completion in the taproom opening checklist.
required_quality_check: Supervisor verifies cleanliness and fridge/tap readiness before service begins.
required_records: Opening checklist signed by staff member and counter-signed by supervisor weekly.
safety: Ensure electrical and fridge equipment are operating correctly. Bathrooms must meet hygiene standards before customer arrival.
common_issues_and_fixes: If POS fails, switch to manual order-taking and notify supervisor.
If taps aren't working, check CO2 or notify brewing team.
improvement: Staff can leave notes at the bottom of the checklist or suggest improvements during weekly team meetings.
